abstract: Study published in journal Neurology finds that NFL retirees who began playing tackle football before the age of 12 had a higher risk of developing memory and thinking problems later in life; findings will likely add fire to debate about when it is safe to allow children to begin playing contact sports.
lead_paragraph: A study of N.F.L. retirees found that those who began playing tackle football when they were younger than 12 increased their risk of developing memory and thinking problems later in life.
snippet: A study of N.F.L. retirees found that those who began playing tackle football when they were younger than 12 increased their risk of developing memory and thinking problems later in life.

headline.main: Study of Retirees Links Youth Football to Brain Problems
headline.print_headline: Study Links Youth Football to Brain Issues of Retirees
